title: Disneyland Paris has cheap breaks for its magical new Frozen event but be quick
text:

Frozen fans have plenty to get excited for over the coming months - not only is the sequel to the beloved Disney film hitting cinemas, but Disneyland Paris is set to host an epic celebration of all things Anna and Elsa!

The best part? You can currently get discounted Disneyland Paris packages to visit the park during the magical event AND the deal is valid for stays during the school holidays.

In fact, MagicBreaks is currently offering discounts of up to 35 per cent off Disney Hotel and Park Ticket packages.

That means you can find two-night packages from £209pp for February half term, which includes a Disney hotel stay and your park tickets, as well as heaps of exclusive extras such as a FREE magical call from Mickey Mouse, a FREE Disney Activity Book and 15 per cent off dining at Planet Hollywood and Earl of Sandwich.

All of the deals are already live on the MagicBreaks website but you'll need to book by the 27th November when the sale ends. (It is worth noting that the cheapest packages are subject to availability).

(Image: Disneyland Paris)

Of course the Frozen Celebration is sure to be a hit with fans of the hit film.

For a start, there will be a new show starring your favourites such as Anna, Elsa, Kristoff, Olaf and Sven, as well as a new sing-along attraction and some exclusive Frozen goodies too.

Oh, and there will even be a chance to meet Olaf!

You can read more about what's in store in our Frozen Celebration guide.

Don't be disheartened if you can't quite make the deals work for you.

The Frozen Celebration runs from the 11th January through to the 3rd May 2020, so there's ample opportunity to visit while it's on. As for a deal?

We've rounded up all the top Disneyland Paris deals and discounts worth being on your radar from packages to day tickets.

In fact, we've also got a round-up of the best cheap hotels near Disneyland Paris if you're planning to include it as part of a wider itinerary.
description: Disneyland Paris breaks for half term are currently temptingly cheap and the best bit is they coincide with the park's new Frozen event
